responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
- headline: Inefficient regular expression in validators/url.py
  analysis: |
    The regular expression in validators/url.py uses a character class with a range that includes both ASCII and non-ASCII characters (e.g., `\u00a1-\uffff`).
    This can lead to performance issues, especially on strings that contain many non-ASCII characters.
    This is because the regular expression engine may have to perform more complex character comparisons when evaluating the range.
  cwe: CWE-1333
  function_names:
    - url
  filenames:
    - validators/url.py
  classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Inefficient regular expression in validators/url.py
leads.analysis:
The regular expression in validators/url.py uses a character class with a range that includes both ASCII and non-ASCII characters (e.g., \u00a1-\uffff).
This can lead to performance issues, especially on strings that contain many non-ASCII characters.
This is because the regular expression engine may have to perform more complex character comparisons when evaluating the range.
